content:
Wearing bright and reflective clothing is a great idea, and making sure your bike lights are functioning well will definitely help increase your visibility on the road.

Regarding bike parking near the dance studio, I've got some good news for you. According to online directories and reviews, there are a few bike parking options near the intersection of Oak Street and Maple Avenue:

1. **Dance Studio's Bike Rack**: The dance studio itself has a bike rack located near the entrance, which can accommodate several bikes. It's a convenient and secure spot to lock up your bike while you're taking class.
2. **Street-Side Bike Racks**: There are a few street-side bike racks located along Oak Street, within a block or two of the dance studio. These racks are installed by the city and are available for public use. Just make sure to lock your bike securely to the rack using a U-lock or chain lock.
3. **Nearby Parking Garage**: There's a public parking garage located about a block away from the dance studio, which has a designated bike parking area on the ground floor. This might be a good option if you're concerned about the security of the street-side racks.

Before you head out, you can double-check the availability and condition of these bike parking options using online directories like BikeLink or SpotHero. It's always a good idea to plan ahead and know where you'll be parking your bike before you arrive.

Remember to lock your bike securely to the rack using a sturdy lock, and consider registering your bike with the local authorities or using a GPS tracking device to deter theft.

Have a safe and enjoyable ride to the dance studio, and I hope you have a great time in class!
